description:
The course mainly uses screenshot videos for illustration combining with Power point slides, pdf documents and online web page material.

This course need about one hours to go through but as it is a practical instruction, you will need to go through it the first time to get a general idea, then doing the tasks while watching it again.

The general steps are: 

1. Install a base system using a netinstall.iso file (either burning it out or using a USB)
2. Install Xorg and Openbox
3. General components of a Operating System: taskbar (panel), network manager, file manager, notification mechanism...
4. Install day-to-day using software (web browser, Skype, spreadsheet,...)

Each needed packages will have detail explanation why they are used.

The course is for those who have already got bored with their Ubuntu/ Linux Mint/ Debian fork systems, or who want to learn more about Linux, or who want to try out Openbox, or who want a lighter yet enough feature and beautiful operating system.
title: Install Ubuntu Openbox: Create Your Own Ubuntu Flavour
